intro: Rottlera aureopunctata, commonly known as the golden dot rottlera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow dots on the leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Rottlera aureopunctata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
